I have no problem, with most of that. :)

One thing to keep in mind, when R=
odimus was sassing the preds, he was saying
it quietly, in fact he whispere=
d it and at that time Tuscon was hovering in
the air which means is that on=
ly Tuscon could have heard it. So from
Rodimus' view point the way Tuscon r=
esponded was a HUGE overreaction, since
he could have just ignored it, like=
 most primes do. Think about how Ratchet
responded to so many of Optimus' i=
deas or those of others. Anyways, it's all
good to me :)

As for that battl=
e of honor, I can imagine that happening, but there are
other factors at wo=
rk. This is not an enemy that you can walk in the front
door, challenge to =
a duel, win and then walk back out. This is one that will
take time to vanq=
uish. Tuscon will be fortunate to get out in one peace. :)

Magmatron is a =
very old soldier, and his been through countless battles and
he is most lik=
ely the most formidable opponant that Tuscon or perhaps anyone
else here on=
 Old Earth has met thus far, except for maybe some of the older
Unicronians=
.

Do not be too quick to act is my advise to Tuscon.

- Preston

<div>I have no problem, with most of that. :)</div>
<div>=A0</div>
<div>One=
 thing to keep in mind, when Rodimus was sassing the preds, he was saying i=
t quietly, in fact he whispered=A0it and at that time Tuscon was hovering i=
n the air=A0which means is that only Tuscon could have heard it. So from Ro=
dimus' view point=A0the way Tuscon responded was a=A0HUGE overreaction,=
 since he could have just ignored it, like most primes do. Think about how =
Ratchet responded to so many of Optimus' ideas or those of others. Anyw=
ays, it's all good to me :)</div>

<div>=A0</div>
<div>As for that batt=
le of honor, I can imagine that happening, but there are other factors at w=
ork. This is not an enemy that you can walk in the front door, challenge to=
 a duel, win and then walk back out. This is one that will take time to van=
quish. Tuscon will be fortunate to get out in one peace. :)</div>

<div>=A0=
</div>
<div>Magmatron is a very old soldier, and his been through countless=
 battles and he is most likely the most formidable opponant that Tuscon=A0o=
r perhaps anyone else here on Old Earth has met thus far, except for maybe =
some of the older Unicronians.=A0</div>

<div>=A0</div>
<div>Do not be too =
quick to act is my advise to Tuscon. </div>
<div>=A0</div>
<div>- Preston=
=A0<br><br></div>

<div>
<div>
<div>
<p>
<div>Cool, so even when Rodimus sees ligh=
tning and hears thunder, he too will think of Tucson or may very well see h=
im and those elements in a dream. =A0After all, he did get an idea of his s=
tormy like temper before they got separated . =A0It would be interesting to=
 have a battle between Magmatron and Tucson, as a challenge to preserve the=
 land from further harm. =A0One on one, in an honorable battle, in warrior =
mode of course. =A0And the one who remains on his feet, wins the freedom of=
 the land and it's inhabitants. =A0He who loses, must retreat honorably=
 and give up the opposition he so desperately fights for. =A0It would be an=
 ultimate test of Honor and courage for Tucson, who must realize that somet=
imes doing the right thing is to anticipate defeat and learn from that in o=
rder to avoid it the next time one faces a formidable enemy. =A0It's a =
lesson no mentor can teach him, it's a lesson he needs to learn on his =
own. =A0</div>

<div><br></div>
<div>I think it's a good plot seeing th=
at for a bot, he has a lot of backbone and unlike Rodimus, perhaps just a l=
ittle too much of it. =A0It goes with having his father's temperament a=
nd stubbornness. =A0That too is turning out to be a challenge for him, beca=
use Ratchet may have been the chief CMO, but never a Prime. =A0Tucson, who =
is very much like Ratchet, is a Prime who is having to work with temperamen=
t issues as well as the issues impacting everyone else.</div>

<div><br></d=
iv>
<div>When Rodimus started sassing the Preds while on Tucson's back,=
 Tucson was trying desperately to form an alliance and was not in the mood =
for snide commentary. =A0His reaction was similar to how Ratchet might have=
 commented on it. =A0Good thing Rodimus didn't get the classic " G=
ive me one good reason why I shouldn't reformat your hard drive and tur=
n you into a garbage scow!"</div>

<div>But when Tucson lost his tempe=
r Rodimus may have picked up on his voice pattern which sounds EXACTLY like=
 Ratchet when he lost his temper. =A0I don't recall Rodimus's relat=
ionship with Ratchet but he could probably get an idea that Tucson is from =
the same mold as the old CMO.</div>

<div class=3D"im">
<div><br>Perpetuall=
y on the move and constantly busy.=A0</div></div>
